verses.text: O \sc Lord\sc* God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.
Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: Render a reward to the proud.
\sc Lord\sc*, how long shall the wicked, How long shall the wicked triumph?
\add How long\add* shall they utter \add and\add* speak hard \add things?\add* \add And\add* all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?
They break in pieces thy people, O \sc Lord\sc*, And afflict thine heritage.
They slay the widow and the stranger, And murder the fatherless.
Yet they say, The \sc Lord\sc* shall not see, Neither shall the God of Jacob regard \add it\add*.
Understand, ye brutish among the people: And ye fools, when will ye be wise?
He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? He that formed the eye, shall he not see?
He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct? He that teacheth man knowledge, \add shall not he know?\add*
The \sc Lord\sc* knoweth the thoughts of man, That they \add are\add* vanity.
Blessed \add is\add* the man whom thou chastenest, O \sc Lord\sc*, And teachest him out of thy law;
That \add thou\add* mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, Until the pit be digged for the wicked.
For the \sc Lord\sc* will not cast off his people, Neither will he forsake his inheritance.
But judgment shall return unto righteousness: And all the upright in heart shall follow it.
Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? \add Or\add* who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
Unless the \sc Lord\sc* \add had been\add* my help, My soul had almost dwelt \add in\add* silence.
When I said, My foot slippeth; Thy mercy, O \sc Lord\sc*, held me up.
In the multitude of my thoughts within me Thy comforts delight my soul.
Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship \add with\add* thee, Which frameth mischief by a law?
They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, And condemn the innocent blood.
But the \sc Lord\sc* is my defence; And my God \add is\add* the rock of my refuge.
And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, And shall cut them off in their own wickedness; \add Yea\add*, the \sc Lord\sc* our God shall cut them off.
